intro: Nesogordonia perrieri, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a large deciduous tree native to the savannas of West Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its thick, buttressed roots and broad, lobed leaves. The tree produces yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing oily seeds, which are used to make shea butter. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat and is valued for its economic contributions.
